issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: EIP routes are lost if toggled between VMs

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
When running an instance there is a delay before the network information is made available. For EDGE mode the delay is a few seconds, for VPCMIDO it can be longer. Network information is processed every 30 seconds by default, so this should limit the delay.

It is not feasible to always process the network information within a particular time limit when running an instance, but in the best case we should be able to start processing the network information within a second of the instance being launched.
fields.summary: Delay in network information processing when running instance

comments.body: Not too bad in EDGE, but noticeable in VPC. Need to decide if this is urgent.

Added an automated test to capture time for instance information to appear in the global xml after a run request. The test also captures the time for the instance xml to be removed once the instance has entered the terminated state.
